intro: Epilobium wallichianum, commonly known as the Himalayan willow herb, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Southern Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest floors and stream banks. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. Its flowers are typically arranged in dense, terminal spikes and bloom in the spring. Epilobium wallichianum is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other species known for their showy flowers and ecological importance.
